fieldVectors: link//pl/beginner/moving-forward/#--kliknij-na-liście,-do-której-chcesz-dołączyć.@@@@- Kliknij na liście, do której chcesz dołączyć.
link//pl/coordination/review/#--have-the-pois-been-mapped-in-all-locations?@@@@- Have the POIs been mapped in all locations?

link//pl/coordination/review/#--are-there-***topology***-errors-(like-overlapping-buildings-or-incorrect-relations)?@@@@- Are there ***topology*** errors (like overlapping buildings or incorrect relations)?

link//pl/coordination/review/#--next-make-sure-that-nothing-is-selected-by-clicking-in-a-blank-spot-on-your-map.-if-you-have-features-selected-when-you-run-the-validation-tool,-only-those-selected-features-will-be-checked.-(sometimes-you-may-want-to-only-check-certain-features,-but-for-now-we-will-check-the-entire-file)@@@@- Next make sure that nothing is selected by clicking in a blank spot on your map.  If you have features selected when you run the Validation Tool, only those selected features will be checked.  (sometimes you may want to only check certain features, but for now we will check the entire file)

link//pl/coordination/review/#--this-is-an-error-that-we-never-would-have-caught-without-the-validation-tool.-if-you-zoom-in-very-close-you-can-see-that-there-is-a-tiny-overlap-between-the-buildings,-which-is-a-topological-error,-because-buildings-don’t-usually-overlap-with-each-other.-to-fix-this,-the-middle-node-needs-to-be-moved.-if-the-buildings-are-actually-touching,-which-they-probably-are,-the-middle-node-can-be-joined-to-the-way.@@@@- This is an error that we never would have caught without the validation tool.  If you zoom in very close you can see that there is a tiny overlap between the buildings, which is a topological error, because buildings don’t usually overlap with each other.  To fix this, the middle node needs to be moved.  If the buildings are actually touching, which they probably are, the middle node can be joined to the way.

link//pl/coordination/review/#--there-are-a-great-many-types-of-query-you-can-search-here,-and-you-can-see-details-and-examples-in-the-search-box-itself-and-by-clicking-on-the-“help”-button.@@@@- There are a great many types of query you can search here, and you can see details and examples in the search box itself and by clicking on the “Help” button.

link//pl/coordination/review/#--be-careful-here!-you-don’t-want-to-edit-the-value-and-click-ok,-because-that-will-change-this-tag-for-every-single-building-feature.-**this-would-be-very-bad.**@@@@- BE CAREFUL HERE!  You don’t want to edit the value and click OK, because that will change this tag for every single building feature.  **This would be very bad.**

link//pl/coordination/review/#--we-cannot-change-the-feature-that-has-the-***building:use=mixed***-tag-here,-because-we-have-hundreds-of-features-selected.-so,-to-correct-the-mistake,-we-must-first-find-it.-how?-you-guessed-it---with-the-search-tool.@@@@- We cannot change the feature that has the ***building:use=mixed*** tag here, because we have hundreds of features selected.  So, to correct the mistake, we must first find it.  How?  You guessed it - with the Search tool.

link//pl/coordination/review/#--first-let’s-select-only-the-polygons-that-are-within-the-target-area.-to-do-this-we-will-use-the-spatial-query-plugin.-if-you-do-not-already-have-it-installed,-go-to-plugins-->-manage-and-install-plugins-to-find-and-install-it.@@@@- First let’s select only the polygons that are within the target area.  To do this we will use the Spatial Query Plugin.  If you do not already have it installed, go to Plugins -> Manage and Install Plugins to find and install it.

link//pl/coordination/review/#--next-let’s-filter-only-the-polygons-that-are-buildings-and-that-were-collected-as-part-of-this-project.@@@@- Next let’s filter only the polygons that are buildings and that were collected as part of this project.

link//pl/coordination/review/#--click-ok.-filtering-the-data-with-this-query-will-only-show-polygons-that-have-something-in-the-building-column.-it-also-removes-buildings-that-do-not-have-the-source-tag-associated-with-this-project.@@@@- Click OK.  Filtering the data with this query will only show polygons that have something in the building column.  It also removes buildings that do not have the source tag associated with this project.

link//pl/coordination/review/#--right-click-on-the-buildings-layer-(the-layer-we-created-in-the-previous-section)-and-click-“filter...”-this-will-open-the-query-builder.-here-we-can-write-complex-queries-to-return-only-the-data-we-want.@@@@- Right-click on the buildings layer (the layer we created in the previous section) and click “Filter...”  This will open the query builder.  Here we can write complex queries to return only the data we want.
link//pl/josm/josm-adding-imagery/@@@@JOSM adding tms, wms or wmts imagery
link//pl/osm-data/osm-in-qgis/#--otwórz-qgis-i-przejdź-do-wektor-->-openstreetmap-->-pobierz-dane...@@@@- Otwórz QGIS i przejdź do Wektor -> OpenStreetMap -> Pobierz dane...

link//pl/osm-data/osm-in-qgis/#--wybierz-nazwę-i-lokalizację-pliku-wyjściowego,-używając-rozszerzenia-pliku-**.osm**-i-kliknij-ok.@@@@- Wybierz nazwę i lokalizację pliku wyjściowego, używając rozszerzenia pliku **.osm** i kliknij OK.
link//pl/osm-data/osm-in-qgis/#--przejdź-do-wektor-->-openstreetmap-->-importuj-topologię-z-xml...@@@@- Przejdź do Wektor -> OpenStreetMap -> Importuj topologię z XML...
link//pl/osm-data/osm-in-qgis/#--przejdź-do-wektor-->-openstreetmap-->-eksportuj-topologię-do-spatialite...@@@@- Przejdź do Wektor -> OpenStreetMap -> Eksportuj topologię do SpatiaLite...

link//pl/osm-data/osm-in-qgis/#--kliknij-"wczytaj-z-bd",-aby-zobaczyć-listę-wszystkich-dostępnych-w-bazie-danych-tagów.-powiększ-okno-przeciągając-narożniki,-jeśli-to-pomoże.-zobaczysz-wszystkie-tagi-zawarte-w-tych-danych,-a-liczbę-obiektów-z-każdego-tagu.@@@@- Kliknij "Wczytaj z BD", aby zobaczyć listę wszystkich dostępnych w bazie danych tagów. Powiększ okno przeciągając narożniki, jeśli to pomoże. Zobaczysz wszystkie tagi zawarte w tych danych, a liczbę obiektów z każdego tagu.

link//pl/coordination/remote/#remote-mapping-is-also-referred-to-as-'armchair-mapping',-and-this-is-probably-the-type-of-mapping-you-will-be-doing-if-attending-a-mapathon.-it-will-help-you-to-understand-what-is-needed-if-you-know-more-about-the-whole-process.-many-people-throughout-the-world-are-involved-in-making-hot-work,-and-when-you-start-remote-mapping-you-become-part-of-that-team,-which-has-many-available-roles,-including-(this-is-not-the-full-list!):@@@@Remote mapping is also referred to as 'Armchair mapping', and this is probably the type of mapping you will be doing if attending a mapathon. It will help you to understand what is needed if you know more about the whole process. Many people throughout the world are involved in making HOT work, and when you start remote mapping you become part of that team, which has many available roles, including (this is not the full list!):

link//pl/coordination/remote/#take-a-few-minutes-to-look-at-each-of-these---just-a-quick-read-so-you-know-roughly-what-we-are-talking-about,-and-where-to-refer-back-to-when-you-need-to:@@@@Take a few minutes to look at each of these - just a quick read so you know roughly what we are talking about, and where to refer back to when you need to:

link//pl/coordination/remote/#--the-id-editor-[learnosm-section-on-id-editor](/en/beginner/id-editor/).-this-editor-is-ideal-for-those-new-to-openstreetmap-editing-and-has-a-gentle-learning-curve.-the-last-section-explains-the-[differences-between-id-&-josm](/en/beginner/id-editor/#id-versus-josm),-and@@@@-  The iD Editor [LearnOSM section on iD Editor](/en/beginner/id-editor/). This editor is ideal for those new to OpenStreetMap editing and has a gentle learning curve. The last section explains the [differences between iD & JOSM](/en/beginner/id-editor/#id-versus-josm), and
link//pl/coordination/remote/#--you-have-an-openstreetmap-account-with-a-username-&-password,@@@@-  You have an OpenStreetMap account with a username & password,

link//pl/coordination/remote/#--[west-african-hot-mapping-tips-by-user-bgirardot](http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/user:bgirardot/typical_road_and_residential_task)@@@@-  [West African HOT Mapping Tips by user Bgirardot](http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/User:Bgirardot/Typical_Road_and_Residential_Task)
link//pl/mobile-mapping/@@@@Mapowanie z pomocą smartfonu, GPS lub kartki papieru
link//pl/mobile-mapping/#--gps-which-will-probably-be-more-accurate-than-your-mobile-phone,@@@@- GPS  which will probably be more accurate than your mobile phone,
link//pl/coordination/tm-admin/#advanced:-define-mapping-project-areas-and-tasks-with-imported-geodata@@@@Advanced: Define mapping project areas and tasks with imported geodata

link//pl/coordination/tm-admin/#--description---used-for-display-in-lists-and-motivational-information-for-mappers@@@@- Description - Used for display in lists and motivational information for mappers

link//pl/coordination/tm-user/#--click-to-view-messages-and-notifications-sent-to-you,-![tm-notifications][]{:style="float:left;height:18px"}-icon,-top-right.@@@@- Click to view messages and notifications sent to you, ![TM notifications][]{:style="float:left;height:18px"} icon, top right.
link//pl/coordination/tm-user/#--search-and-filter-options-along-the-top@@@@- Search and Filter options along the top

link//pl/coordination/tm-user/#--**search-projects**---if-you-know-the-number-of-the-project-you-want-to-work-on,-you-can-enter-it-in-'search-projects'-and-be-taken-directly-to-it.-you-can-also-search-on-text-from-within-the-project-description.@@@@- **Search Projects** - If you know the number of the project you want to work on, you can enter it in 'Search Projects' and be taken directly to it. You can also search on text from within the project description.
link//pl/coordination/tm-user/#icons-indicate-the-types-of-mapping,-such-as;@@@@Icons indicate the types of mapping, such as;

link//pl/coordination/tm-user/#--**tasks**-a-list-of-tasks-which-can-be-filtered-according-to-'all',-'available-for-mapping',-or-'ready-for-validation'.@@@@- **Tasks** A list of tasks which can be filtered according to 'All', 'Available for mapping', or 'Ready for validation'.
link//pl/coordination/tm-user/#--the-uncolored-tasks-are-ready-and-available-for-mapping@@@@- The uncolored tasks are ready and available for mapping

link//pl/coordination/tm-user/#--**completion**-where-you-will-later-indicate-why-you-have-left-this-task,-such-as-you-have-completed-the-required-mapping,-or-you-were-unable-to-finish-it-for-some-reason---make-sure-you-leave-a-message-indicating-why,-such-as-"-*run-out-of-time,-i've-done-all-of-the-top-half-of-the-square,-but-there-is-a-lot-more-to-be-done-in-the-bottom-half*-"-before-you-select-**select-another-task**.@@@@- **COMPLETION** where you will later indicate why you have left this task, such as you have completed the required mapping, or you were unable to finish it for some reason - make sure you leave a message indicating why, such as " *Run out of time, I've done all of the top half of the square, but there is a lot more to be done in the bottom half* " before you select **Select another Task**.
link//pl/coordination/tm-user/#ending-your-mapping-of-a-task-or-square@@@@Ending your mapping of a Task or Square
link//pl/coordination/tm-user/#unlocking-a-task-before-it-is-complete@@@@Unlocking a Task before it is complete
link//pl/coordination/tm-user/#submit-task-or-unlocking-a-task-that-is-completely-mapped@@@@Submit Task or Unlocking a Task that is completely mapped
link//pl/coordination/tm-user/#sending-a-message-from-the-comment-box@@@@Sending a message from the comment box
link//pl/coordination/tm-user/#referring-to-a-particular-task-when-sending-an-email@@@@Referring to a particular task when sending an email
link//pl/coordination/tm-user/#1.-click-on-the-task-square-concerned@@@@1. Click on the task square concerned
link//pl/coordination/tm-user/#leaving-a-project-question-/-comment-/-contacting-the-project-creator@@@@Leaving a Project question / comment / contacting the Project creator

link//pl/coordination/tm-user/#once-in-the-editor-of-their-choice,-**the-validator-will-have-to-manually-download-the-osm-data**-for-task-areas-selected.-this-is-to-prevent-downloading-all-of-the-osm-data-between-the-selected-tasks.@@@@Once in the editor of their choice, **the validator will have to manually download the OSM data** for task areas selected. This is to prevent downloading all of the OSM data between the selected Tasks.

link//pl/coordination/tm-user/#once-in-the-editor-of-their-choice,-**the-validator-will-have-to-manually-download-the-osm-data**-for-task-areas-selected.-this-is-to-prevent-downloading-all-of-the-osm-data-between-the-selected-tasks.@@@@Once in the editor of their choice, **the validator will have to manually download the OSM data** for task areas selected. This is to prevent downloading all of the OSM data between the selected tasks.
link//pl/mobile-mapping/gpslogger/#automated-collection-and-uploading-of-gps-tracks@@@@Automated collection and uploading of gps tracks
link//pl/beginner/id-editor/#--edytor-id-wymaga-aktywnego-połączenia-z-internetem.@@@@- Edytor iD wymaga aktywnego połączenia z internetem.

link//pl/beginner/id-editor/#--twój-kursor-zmieni-się-na-znak-plusa-(+).-teraz-kliknij-w-miejscu,-które-znasz,-aby-zaznaczyć-jego-lokalizację.-na-przykład,-jeżeli-wiesz,-że-w-twojej-okolicy-jest-szpital,-kliknij-w-miejscu,-gdzie-znajduje-się-budynek-szpitala.@@@@- Twój kursor zmieni się na znak plusa (+). Teraz kliknij w miejscu, które znasz, aby zaznaczyć jego lokalizację. Na przykład, jeżeli wiesz, że w Twojej okolicy jest szpital, kliknij w miejscu, gdzie znajduje się budynek szpitala.

link//pl/beginner/id-editor/#--twój-kursor-zmieni-się-na-znak-plusa-(+).-znajdź-drogę,-która-nie-została-jeszcze-narysowana-na-mapie-i-ją-odwzoruj.-kliknij-raz-w-punkcie,-gdzie-zaczyna-się-segment-drogi,-przesuń-mysz-i-kliknij,-aby-dodać-kolejny-punkt.-kliknij-dwukrotnie,-aby-zakończyć-proces-rysowania.-zwróć-uwagę-na-panel-po-lewej-stronie.@@@@- Twój kursor zmieni się na znak plusa (+). Znajdź drogę, która nie została jeszcze narysowana na mapie i ją odwzoruj. Kliknij raz w punkcie, gdzie zaczyna się segment drogi, przesuń mysz i kliknij, aby dodać kolejny punkt. Kliknij dwukrotnie, aby zakończyć proces rysowania. Zwróć uwagę na panel po lewej stronie.

link//pl/beginner/id-editor/#--twój-kursor-zmieni-się-na-znak-plusa-(+).-spróbuj-odrysować-budynek-używając-podkładu-jako-pomocy.@@@@- Twój kursor zmieni się na znak plusa (+). Spróbuj odrysować budynek używając podkładu jako pomocy.
link//pl/beginner/id-editor/#--pokaże-to-wszystkie-tagi-przypisane-do-obiektu.@@@@- Pokaże to wszystkie tagi przypisane do obiektu.
link//pl/beginner/id-editor/#--kiedy-dodajesz-wiele-budynków-(zobacz-wtyczkę-buildings_tool)@@@@- Kiedy dodajesz wiele budynków (zobacz wtyczkę buildings_tool)
link//pl/@@@@"OpenStreetMap to wolna i darmowa mapa świata ze szczegółowością na poziomie ulic, tworzona przez stale rosnącą społeczność twórców map."

link//pl/coordination/mapathon/#--experience-taught-us-that-the-learning-curve-for-people-with-no-mapping-experience-whatsoever-is-very-steep-and-can-be-off-putting-and-frustrating-for-these-newcomers-if-they-cannot-get-some-mapping-done-on-their-first-event.-it-is-important-to-get-them-mapping-as-quickly-as-possible,-so-they-were-shown-just-the-very-basics-with-the-simpler-id-editor,-letting-them-encounter-their-own-particular-problems-during-the-course-of-the-evening-when-they-were-able-to-ask-for-help.@@@@-   Experience taught us that the learning curve for people with no mapping experience whatsoever is very steep and can be off putting and frustrating for these newcomers if they cannot get some mapping done on their first event. It is important to get them mapping as quickly as possible, so they were shown just the very basics with the simpler iD editor, letting them encounter their own particular problems during the course of the evening when they were able to ask for help.

link//pl/coordination/mapathon/#start-working-on-your-mapathon-at-least-a-month-before-for-organising-and-preparing-the-event.@@@@Start working on your Mapathon at least a month before for organising and preparing the event.
link//pl/coordination/mapathon/#first-step-...-preparing-the-format-of-your-mapathon.@@@@First step ... Preparing the format of your Mapathon.

link//pl/mobile-mapping/osmand2/#--the-**map-configuration**-button-brings-up-a-menu-for-selecting-the-profile-to-use.-you-may-choose-from:-browse-map,-car,-bicycle,-pedestrian-to-determine-how-much,-or-little-details-are-shown-on-the-canvass.-it-also-shows@@@@- The **Map Configuration** button brings up a menu for selecting the profile to use.  You may choose from: Browse Map, Car, Bicycle, Pedestrian to determine how much, or little details are shown on the canvass. It also shows
link//pl/mobile-mapping/osmand2/#adding-notes-and-comments,-bug-reporting,-closing-bugs@@@@Adding Notes and Comments, Bug Reporting, Closing Bugs
link//pl/mobile-mapping/osmand2/#--yellow-(local,-or-still-in-the-device),@@@@- yellow (local, or still in the device),

link//pl/mobile-mapping/osmand2/#--id-more-information-at-[configuring-the-background-layer](/en/beginner/id-editor/#configuring-the-background-layer).@@@@- iD more information at [Configuring the Background Layer](/en/beginner/id-editor/#configuring-the-background-layer).

link//pl/mobile-mapping/osmtracker/#--**voice-record-duration**---your-choice,-but-30-seconds-is-used-by-the-author.@@@@-  **Voice record duration** - your choice, but 30 seconds is used by the author.

link//pl/mobile-mapping/osmtracker/#--**one-directory-per-track**-recommended-as-this-will-result-in-all-of-the-related-voice-recordings,-photographs,-text-notes-and-the-gpx-trace-all-being-stored-in-the-same-folder,-named-with-the-date-and-time-of-the-gpx-file-creation.@@@@-  **One directory per track** Recommended as this will result in all of the related voice recordings, photographs, text notes and the gpx trace all being stored in the same folder, named with the date and time of the gpx file creation.

link//pl/mobile-mapping/osmtracker/#--**map-tile-provider**-if-you've-elected-to-download-map-data-as-a-background-when-you-display-the-map,-you-can-choose-which-version-of-the-map-to-use-as-a-background.@@@@-  **Map Tile Provider** If you've elected to download map data as a background when you display the map, you can choose which version of the map to use as a background.
link//pl/mobile-mapping/osmtracker/#--**resume-tracking**-useful-when-you-realise-you've-missed-a-bit!@@@@-  **Resume Tracking** useful when you realise you've missed a bit!
link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager/#--access-a-list-of-projects-for-which-you-have-completed-squares,@@@@- Access a list of projects for which you have completed squares,

link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager/#--mauve-line-normally-visible-in-the-perimeter-squares-of-a-project-indicates-the-border-of-the-project.-this-border-normally-follows-the-available-imagery,-so-may-appear-an-unusual-shape.-although-mapping-may-be-completed-outside-this-border,-it-is-not-a-requirement-and-will-not-be-considered-by-validators.@@@@- Mauve line normally visible in the perimeter squares of a project indicates the border of the project. This border normally follows the available imagery, so may appear an unusual shape. Although mapping may be completed outside this border, it is not a requirement and will not be considered by validators.

link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager/#--road-networks:-used-by-people-on-the-ground-to-load-data-into-hand-held-navigation-tools,-and-to-work-out-how-to-access-remote-areas@@@@- Road networks: Used by people on the ground to load data into hand held navigation tools, and to work out how to access remote areas
link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager/#unlocking-a-square-before-it-is-complete@@@@Unlocking a square before it is complete
link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager/#sending-a-message-from-the-comment-box@@@@Sending a message from the comment box
link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager/#referring-to-a-particular-square-when-sending-an-email@@@@Referring to a particular square when sending an email
link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager/#--to-the-right-of-the-screen-is-a-list-of-users-that-are-online-now.@@@@- To the right of the screen is a list of users that are online now.

link//pl/josm/more-about-josm/#--draw-a-box-around-the-area-that-you-want-to-download.-to-draw-a-new-box,-click-on-the-map,-hold-your-left-mouse-button-down,-and-drag-your-mouse-to-create-a-box.-release-the-mouse-button-to-finish-drawing-the-box.@@@@-   Draw a box around the area that you want to download. To draw a new box, click on the map, hold your left mouse button down, and drag your mouse to create a box. Release the mouse button to finish drawing the box.

link//pl/josm/more-about-josm/#--use-the-techniques-you-have-already-learned-to-add-a-couple-points-to-the-map-of-places-that-you-know.-if-you-see-any-mistakes,-try-to-fix-them.@@@@-   Use the techniques you have already learned to add a couple points to the map of places that you know. If you see any mistakes, try to fix them.

link//pl/josm/more-about-josm/#--if-this-is-your-first-time-saving-changes-to-openstreetmap,-you-will-be-asked-for-your-openstreetmap-username-and-password.@@@@-   If this is your first time saving changes to OpenStreetMap, you will be asked for your OpenStreetMap username and password.
link//pl/josm/josm-conflict-resolution/#--**properties:**-object-has-been-moved-(coordinates)-or-deleted@@@@- **Properties:**  Object has been moved (coordinates) or deleted
link//pl/josm/josm-conflict-resolution/#resolving-differences-in-the-node-list-of-two-versions-of-a-way@@@@Resolving differences in the node list of two versions of a way
link//pl/josm/josm-conflict-resolution/#a-simple-workflow:-keep-the-node-list-from-your-local-object-version@@@@A simple workflow: Keep the node list from your local object version
link//pl/hot-tips/tagging/#relations---takie,-jak-budynki-z-dziedzińcami-lub-wyspy-na-rzece@@@@Relations - takie, jak budynki z dziedzińcami lub wyspy na rzece

link//pl/hot-tips/tracing-round-buildings/#--place-your-points-where-the-walls-will-reach-the-ground---3-points-is-the-minimum.-double-click-on-the-last-point-to-finish-tracing-an-area.-use-the-tool-to-make-it-round---shortcut-**o**-in-english.@@@@- Place your points where the walls will reach the ground - 3 points is the minimum. Double click on the last point to finish tracing an area. Use the tool to make it round - shortcut **o** in English.

link//pl/hot-tips/tracing-round-buildings/#--move-each-of-the-corners-so-they-are-now-on-the-perimeter-of-the-round-building,@@@@- move each of the corners so they are now on the perimeter of the round building,

link//pl/beginner/start-osm/#--jeżeli-masz-mysz-z-kółkiem,-przybliż-i-oddal-mapę-kręcąc-nim.-jeżeli-nie-masz-kółka,-użyj-przycisków-+-i---w-prawym-górnym-rogu-mapy-(zobacz-obraz-poniżej).@@@@-   Jeżeli masz mysz z kółkiem, przybliż i oddal mapę kręcąc nim. Jeżeli nie masz kółka, użyj przycisków + i - w prawym górnym rogu mapy (zobacz obraz poniżej).

link//pl/beginner/start-osm/#--teraz,-kiedy-zobaczyłeś,-jak-wygląda-główna-strona,-możesz-zarejestrować-się-i-utworzyć-konto,-a-następnie-dodać-swoje-pierwsze-punkty-do-mapy.@@@@-   Teraz, kiedy zobaczyłeś, jak wygląda główna strona, możesz zarejestrować się i utworzyć konto, a następnie dodać swoje pierwsze punkty do mapy.

link//pl/beginner/start-osm/#--na-tej-stronie-jest-pięć-pól,-które-musisz-wypełnić,-aby-zarejestrować-konto-w-osm.@@@@-   Na tej stronie jest pięć pól, które musisz wypełnić, aby zarejestrować konto w OSM.

link//pl/beginner/start-osm/#--otworzy-się-nowe-okno-lub-karta.-jeżeli-wszystko-poszło-dobrze-powinieneś-mieć-konto-osm!@@@@-   Otworzy się nowe okno lub karta. Jeżeli wszystko poszło dobrze powinieneś mieć konto OSM!

link//pl/beginner/start-osm/#--teraz,-kiedy-jesteś-już-zalogowany-na-stronie-openstreetmap,-możesz-użyć-edytora-id,-aby-dodać-swój-pierwszy-punkt-do-mapy.@@@@-   Teraz, kiedy jesteś już zalogowany na stronie OpenStreetMap, możesz użyć edytora iD, aby dodać swój pierwszy punkt do mapy.

link//pl/beginner/start-osm/#--wybierz-z-menu-po-lewej-stronie,-jakiego-rodzaju-miejsce-dodajesz-do-mapy.-następnie-możesz-wypełnić-odpowiedni-formularz-z-nazwą-miejsca-i-innymi-informacjami.@@@@-   Wybierz z menu po lewej stronie, jakiego rodzaju miejsce dodajesz do mapy. Następnie możesz wypełnić odpowiedni formularz z nazwą miejsca i innymi informacjami.

link//pl/mobile-mapping/field-papers/#--take-your-field-paper-outside,-and-use-it-as-a-guide-to-walk-and-identify-new-places-that-are-not-on-the-map.@@@@- Take your Field Paper outside, and use it as a guide to walk and identify new places that are not on the map.

link//pl/mobile-mapping/field-papers/#once-you-have-your-field-paper-scanned-and-saved-on-the-computer,-open-your-web-browser-and-return-to-fieldpapers.org,-just-as-before.@@@@Once you have your Field Paper scanned and saved on the computer, open your web browser and return to fieldpapers.org, just as before.
link//pl/mobile-mapping/field-papers/#--open-josm-and-go-to-edit-->-preferences.@@@@- Open JOSM and go to Edit -> Preferences.

link//pl/mobile-mapping/field-papers/#now-can-load-your-field-paper-into-josm-and-use-it-to-add-the-information-you-collected-to-openstreetmap.-unless-you-still-have-the-web-page-with-your-snapshots-open-or-stored-a-bookmark-to-it,-return-to-the-field-papers-website,-by-typing-[fieldpapers.org](http://fieldpapers.org/)-in-your-web-browser,-just-as-before.@@@@Now can load your Field Paper into JOSM and use it to add the information you collected to OpenStreetMap. Unless you still have the web page with your snapshots open or stored a bookmark to it, return to the Field Papers website, by typing [fieldpapers.org](http://fieldpapers.org/) in your web browser, just as before.

link//pl/mobile-mapping/basicairdata-gpslogger/#--więcej-informacji-o-tej-aplikacji-możesz-przeczytać-w-[tym-artykule](http://www.basicairdata.eu/projects/android/android-gps-logger/).
@@@@- Więcej informacji o tej aplikacji możesz przeczytać w [tym artykule](http://www.basicairdata.eu/projects/android/android-gps-logger/).
link//pl/hot-tips/tracing-rectangular-buildings/#--to-finish-tracing-an-area,-double-click-on-the-last-point,@@@@- To finish tracing an area, double click on the last point,
link//pl/osm-data/osm2pgsql/#--kliknij-ok-kilka-razy,-aby-zapisać-nowe-ustawienia.@@@@- Kliknij OK kilka razy, aby zapisać nowe ustawienia.

link//pl/osm-data/osm2pgsql/#--kliknij-ok,-aby-zapisać-ustawienia-połączenia.-następnie-kliknij-"połącz",-aby-połączyć-się-ze-swoim-serwerem-postgresql.@@@@- Kliknij OK, aby zapisać ustawienia połączenia. Następnie kliknij "Połącz", aby połączyć się ze swoim serwerem PostgreSQL.

link//pl/osm-data/osm2pgsql/#--wybierz-jedną-lub-więcej-warstw-i-kliknij-"dodaj".-jeżeli-pojawi-się-pytanie,-wybierz-wgs84-jako-system-odniesienia.@@@@- Wybierz jedną lub więcej warstw i kliknij "Dodaj". Jeżeli pojawi się pytanie, wybierz WGS84 jako system odniesienia.
link//pl/mobile-mapping/gomap/#move-a-node,-a-way,-or-a-node-in-a-way@@@@Move a node, a way, or a node in a way

link//pl/josm/josm-relations/#--select-all-of-the-polygons.-remember-you-can-select-multiple-objects-by-holding-shift-and-clicking-on-each.@@@@- Select all of the polygons. Remember you can select multiple objects by holding SHIFT and clicking on each.

link//pl/josm/josm-relations/#--observe-that-at-the-top-of-the-panel-are-the-tags-for-the-relation.-these-tags-work-the-same-way-as-tags-always-work.@@@@- Observe that at the top of the panel are the tags for the relation. These tags work the same way as tags always work.

link//pl/josm/josm-relations/#--first,-select-all-of-the-ways-which-the-route-runs-along.-you-may-need-to-split-some-streets-into-separate-segments-if-only-part-of-them-belong-to-the-relation.-you-can-do-this-using-the-"split-way"-tool.@@@@- First, select all of the ways which the route runs along. You may need to split some streets into separate segments if only part of them belong to the relation. You can do this using the "Split Way" tool.

link//pl/josm/josm-relations/#--notice-that-there-are-already-tags-which-define-the-relation-as-a-route.-instead-of-*type=multipolygon*,-we-have-*type=route*.-we-also-have-a-tag-defining-it-as-a-bus-route,-as-opposed-to-another-type-of-route.@@@@- Notice that there are already tags which define the relation as a route. Instead of *type=multipolygon*, we have *type=route*. We also have a tag defining it as a bus route, as opposed to another type of route.
link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager3-project-admin/#access-levels-within-the-osm-tasking-manager-3@@@@Access Levels within the OSM Tasking Manager 3
link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager3-project-admin/#prześlij-plik-geojson-lub-kml-z-obszarem-zainteresowania-do-zmapowania@@@@Prześlij plik GeoJSON lub KML z obszarem zainteresowania do zmapowania
link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager3-project-admin/#używanie-kwadratowej-siatki-do-zadań-w-kwadratch@@@@Używanie kwadratowej siatki do zadań w kwadratch

link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager3-project-admin/#--całkiem-nowy-maper-na-mapathonie-mapuje-obszar-około-cztery-razy-wolniej-niż-doświadczony-(wielu-zaczyna-dużo-wolniej,-ale-wkrótce-przyspiesza).@@@@-  Całkiem nowy maper na mapathonie mapuje obszar około cztery razy wolniej niż doświadczony (wielu zaczyna dużo wolniej, ale wkrótce przyspiesza).

link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager3-project-admin/#--opis---używany-do-wyświetlenia-na-liście-i-informacji-motywujących-maperów@@@@- Opis - Używany do wyświetlenia na liście i informacji motywujących maperów
link//pl/hot-tips/saving/@@@@Zapisywanie - komentarz do zestawu zmian i kończenie kwadratu w Task Managerze - edytor iD
link//pl/hot-tips/saving/#tasking-manager---kończenie-kwadratu-lub-przerwanie-prac-przed-jego-ukończeniem.@@@@Tasking Manager - Kończenie kwadratu lub przerwanie prac przed jego ukończeniem.

link//pl/hot-tips/saving/#--**mark-as-completely-mapped**-the-square-you-were-working-on-will-turn-yellow-to-show-it-is-complete-and-awaiting-validation.@@@@- **MARK AS COMPLETELY MAPPED** the square you were working on will turn yellow to show it is complete and awaiting validation.
link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager3/#--zobaczyć-swój-profil-w-tasking-managerze,-gdzie-możesz:@@@@- Zobaczyć swój profil w Tasking Managerze, gdzie możesz:
link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager3/#finding-a-project---tasking-manager-3-contribute-screen@@@@Finding a Project - Tasking Manager 3 Contribute Screen
link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager3/#--opcje-szukaj-i-filtruj-po-lewej-stronie@@@@- Opcje Szukaj i Filtruj po lewej stronie

link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager3/#--numer-projektu---jeżeli-znasz-numer-projektu,-nad-którym-chcesz-pracować,-to-możesz-go-tutaj-podać,-a-zostaniesz-przeniesiony-bezpośrednio-do-niego.@@@@- Numer projektu - Jeżeli znasz numer projektu, nad którym chcesz pracować, to możesz go tutaj podać, a zostaniesz przeniesiony bezpośrednio do niego.
link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager3/#--opis-ważności-projektu-i-informacje,-jak-będą-używane-dane@@@@- Opis ważności projektu i informacje, jak będą używane dane
link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager3/#--zadania-bez-koloru-są-gotowe-i-dostępne-do-mapowania@@@@- Zadania bez koloru są gotowe i dostępne do mapowania

link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager3/#--sieć-drogowa:-używana-przez-ludzi-w-terenie-do-wczytania-danych-do-przenośnych-urządzeń-nawigacyjnych-i-znalezienia-drogi-do-oddalonych-terenów@@@@- Sieć drogowa: Używana przez ludzi w terenie do wczytania danych do przenośnych urządzeń nawigacyjnych i znalezienia drogi do oddalonych terenów
link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager3/#powoływanie-się-na-konkretne-zadanie-przy-wysyłaniu-emaila@@@@Powoływanie się na konkretne zadanie przy wysyłaniu emaila
link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager3/#dodawanie-do-projektu-pytań-/-komentarzy-/-kontakt-z-twórcą-projektu@@@@Dodawanie do projektu  pytań / komentarzy / kontakt z twórcą projektu

link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager3/#--przerwij-weryfikację---kiedy-nie-możesz-dokończyć-procesu-weryfikacji,-ale-musisz-już-skończyć.@@@@- Przerwij weryfikację - Kiedy nie możesz dokończyć procesu weryfikacji, ale musisz już skończyć.
link//pl/osm-data/postgresql/#--kliknij-"**add-file**"-i-znajdź-plik-shape-w-swoim-komputerze.@@@@- Kliknij "**Add File**" i znajdź plik shape w swoim komputerze.
link//pl/osm-data/postgresql/#--otwórz-qgis-i-kliknij-przycisk-![qgis-add-postgis-button][]{:-height="24px"}.@@@@- Otwórz QGIS i kliknij przycisk ![qgis add postgis button][]{: height="24px"}.

link//pl/osm-data/postgresql/#--kliknij-**ok**,-aby-zapisać-parametry-połączenia.-następnie-naciśnij-"połącz",-żeby-połączyć-się-ze-swoim-serwerem-postgresql.-możesz-zostać-poproszony-ponownie-o-nazwę-użytkownika-i-hasło.@@@@- Kliknij **OK**, aby zapisać parametry połączenia. Następnie naciśnij "Połącz", żeby połączyć się ze swoim serwerem PostgreSQL. Możesz zostać poproszony ponownie o nazwę użytkownika i hasło.

link//pl/josm/creating-presets/#--**root-element:**-the-outermost-element-of-an-xml-document,-which-describes-what-is-contained@@@@- **root element:** the outermost element of an XML document, which describes what is contained

link//pl/josm/creating-presets/#--find-the-xml-file-on-your-computer-and-open-it-with-a-text-editor.-if-you-are-using-windows-you-can-use-the-notepad-program.-if-you-want-a-more-easy-to-use-editor,-you-might-download-the-free-notepad++-application.@@@@- Find the XML file on your computer and open it with a text editor. If you are using Windows you can use the Notepad program. If you want a more easy-to-use editor, you might download the free Notepad++ application.
link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager-project-admin/#access-levels-within-the-osm-tasking-manager-2@@@@Access Levels within the OSM Tasking Manager 2
link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager-project-admin/#the-osm-tasking-manager-2-has-three-user-access-levels:@@@@The OSM Tasking Manager 2 has three user access levels:
link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager-project-admin/#draw-an-area-of-interest-to-be-mapped@@@@Draw an area of interest to be mapped
link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager-project-admin/#upload-a-geojson-or-kml-file-of-the-area-of-interest-to-be-mapped@@@@Upload a GeoJSON or KML file of the area of interest to be mapped
link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager-project-admin/#using-the-square-grid-for-task-squares@@@@Using the Square Grid for task squares

link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager-project-admin/#--a-brand-new-mapper-at-a-mapathon-will-map-an-area-at-roughly-a-quarter-of-the-speed-of-an-experienced-mapper-(many-start-off-far-slower,-but-soon-get-faster),.@@@@-  A brand new mapper at a mapathon will map an area at roughly a quarter of the speed of an experienced mapper (many start off far slower, but soon get faster),.

link//pl/coordination/tasking-manager-project-admin/#out-of-date-wiki-entry---for-update-when-this-guide-complete-http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/tasking_manager_admin@@@@Out of date wiki entry - for update when this guide complete  http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Tasking_manager_admin

link//pl/josm/start-josm/#--if-you-have-a-copy-of-josm-on-a-cd-or-usb-flash-drive,-you-can-skip-to-the-next-section,-install-josm.@@@@-   If you have a copy of JOSM on a CD or usb flash drive, you can skip to the next section, Install JOSM.
link//pl/josm/start-josm/#--find-the-josm-install-file-on-your-computer.-double-click-it-to-begin-setup.@@@@-   Find the JOSM install file on your computer. Double-click it to begin setup.
link//pl/josm/start-josm/#--on-the-left-side,-click-the-icon-that-looks-like-a-paint-can-and-paint-brush.@@@@-   On the left side, click the icon that looks like a paint can and paint brush.

link//pl/josm/start-josm/#--now-let’s-open-up-a-sample-osm-file-which-we-will-use-to-learn-the-basic-ways-to-draw-maps-with-josm.-note-that-this-map-is-not-real,-in-that-it-is-not-a-real-map-of-a-real-place,-so-we-will-not-save-it-on-openstreetmap.@@@@-   Now let’s open up a sample OSM file which we will use to learn the basic ways to draw maps with JOSM. Note that this map is not real, in that it is not a real map of a real place, so we will not save it on OpenStreetMap.

link//pl/josm/start-josm/#--find-the-file-**sample.osm**.-it-is-probably-in-your-downloads-folder,-unless-you-saved-it-somewhere-else.-click-on-it,-and-then-click-“open”.@@@@-   Find the file **sample.osm**. It is probably in your Downloads folder, unless you saved it somewhere else. Click on it, and then click “Open”.

link//pl/josm/start-josm/#--you-may-notice-that-when-you-select-an-object,-a-list-appears-to-the-right-of-the-map-in-a-window-called-“properties”.-these-are-known-as-tags.-tags-are-information-that-is-tied-to-a-point,-line-or-shape-that-describes-what-it-is.-we’ll-learn-more-about-tags-in-a-later-chapter.-for-now-all-you-need-to-know-is-that-this-information-helps-describe-whether-our-object-is-a-forest,-a-river,-a-building,-or-something-else.@@@@-   You may notice that when you select an object, a list appears to the right of the map in a window called “Properties”. These are known as tags. Tags are information that is tied to a point, line or shape that describes what it is. We’ll learn more about tags in a later chapter. For now all you need to know is that this information helps describe whether our object is a forest, a river, a building, or something else.

link//pl/josm/start-josm/#--before-you-draw,-you-need-to-make-sure-that-nothing-is-selected.-click-in-the-black-space-on-the-map,-where-it-is-empty,-to-make-sure-nothing-is-selected.@@@@-   Before you draw, you need to make sure that nothing is selected. Click in the black space on the map, where it is empty, to make sure nothing is selected.

link//pl/josm/start-josm/#--find-an-empty-area-on-the-map,-and-double-click-with-your-mouse.-this-will-draw-a-single-point.@@@@-   Find an empty area on the map, and double-click with your mouse. This will draw a single point.

link//pl/josm/start-josm/#--select-one-of-the-objects-that-you-drew-with-the-draw-tool.-on-the-top-menu,-click-“presets”.-move-your-mouse-through-the-sub-menu-to-the-type-of-location-you-would-like-to-define.@@@@-   Select one of the objects that you drew with the Draw tool. On the top menu, click “Presets”. Move your mouse through the sub-menu to the type of location you would like to define.

link//pl/josm/start-josm/#--now-let’s-draw-a-map-in-order-to-practice-the-techniques-you-have-learned.-you-may-wish-to-redraw-the-map-that-you-drew-on-paper-previously.@@@@-   Now let’s draw a map in order to practice the techniques you have learned. You may wish to redraw the map that you drew on paper previously.

link//pl/mobile-mapping/using-gps/#--the-gps-has-different-screens-and-menus-that-allow-you-to-do-different-things.-to-switch-between-screens,-press-the-button-marked-“x”,-just-above-the-power-button-on-the-right-side-of-the-device.-this-button-also-serves-to-go-back.-if-you-press-something-by-mistake-and-would-like-to-cancel-or-go-back,-press-the-“x”-button.@@@@-   The GPS has different screens and menus that allow you to do different things. To switch between screens, press the button marked “X”, just above the power button on the right side of the device. This button also serves to go back. If you press something by mistake and would like to cancel or go back, press the “X” button.
link//pl/mobile-mapping/using-gps/#<!---note-unnecessary-perhaps?-add-to-advanced-section@@@@<!-- note unnecessary perhaps? add to advanced section

link//pl/mobile-mapping/using-gps/#--you-can-see-on-this-page-some-information-about-the-waypoint-that-you-are-saving.-first-is-the-name.-if-this-is-your-first-waypoint,-it-probably-reads-“001”.-this-is-the-number-you-should-record-on-paper-along-with-the-information-you-want-to-collect-with-this-object.-next-you-will-see-the-time-and-date-when-the-point-is-recorded.-below-that-are-the-coordinates,-followed-by-the-altitude.@@@@-   You can see on this page some information about the waypoint that you are saving. First is the name. If this is your first waypoint, it probably reads “001”. This is the number you should record on paper along with the information you want to collect with this object. Next you will see the time and date when the point is recorded. Below that are the coordinates, followed by the altitude.

link//pl/mobile-mapping/using-gps/#--now-that-we-have-learned-how-to-save-points,-let’s-learn-how-to-turn-the-track-log-on-and-off.-when-the-track-log-is-turned-on,-it-will-automatically-record-your-path.-it’s-good-practice-to-turn-on-the-log-when-you-begin-mapping,-and-turn-it-off-when-you-are-finished.-you-will-then-be-able-to-look-at-the-track-on-a-computer-and-see-the-path-that-you-mapped.-if-you-would-like-to-map-the-course-of-a-road,-it-is-a-good-idea-to-save-a-waypoint-at-the-beginning-and-end-of-the-road,-writing-in-your-notebook-the-name-and-type-of-the-road,-and-any-other-important-information-about-the-road.@@@@-   Now that we have learned how to save points, let’s learn how to turn the track log on and off. When the track log is turned on, it will automatically record your path. It’s good practice to turn on the log when you begin mapping, and turn it off when you are finished. You will then be able to look at the track on a computer and see the path that you mapped. If you would like to map the course of a road, it is a good idea to save a waypoint at the beginning and end of the road, writing in your notebook the name and type of the road, and any other important information about the road.

link//pl/mobile-mapping/using-gps/#--if-you-would-like-to-empty-the-track-log-to-delete-earlier-recordings,-use-the-joystick-to-select-“clear”,-and-press-the-joystick-down.-the-bar-at-the-top-should-read-“0%”.@@@@-   If you would like to empty the track log to delete earlier recordings, use the joystick to select “Clear”, and press the joystick down. The bar at the top should read “0%”.
link//pl/mobile-mapping/using-gps/#copy-waypoints-and-tracks-to-the-computer@@@@Copy Waypoints and Tracks to the Computer

link//pl/mobile-mapping/using-gps/#--first,-turn-off-the-track-log-on-your-gps,-by-going-to-the-track-page-and-selecting-“off”.@@@@-   First, turn off the track log on your GPS, by going to the track page and selecting “Off”.

link//pl/mobile-mapping/using-gps/#--gpsbabel-is-a-program-that-allows-us-to-copy-data-from-the-gps.-if-you-have-a-copy-of-gpsbabel-on-a-cd-or-usb-flash-drive,-you-can-skip-to-the-next-section.@@@@-   GPSBabel is a program that allows us to copy data from the GPS. If you have a copy of GPSBabel on a CD or usb flash drive, you can skip to the next section.
link//pl/mobile-mapping/using-gps/#--locate-the-gpsbabel-setup-file-on-your-computer.-double-click-it-to-install.@@@@-   Locate the GPSBabel setup file on your computer. Double-click it to install.

link//pl/mobile-mapping/using-gps/#--click-“file-name”-and-type-a-name-for-your-saved-file.-it-should-be-something-that-describes-the-data,-such-as-the-date-and-the-location.-for-example,-_jakarta-07-07-2011_@@@@-   Click “File Name” and type a name for your saved file. It should be something that describes the data, such as the date and the location. For example, _jakarta-07-07-2011_
link//pl/osm-data/geofabrik-and-hot-export/#pozyskiwanie danych osm-ze-strony geofabrik@@@@Pozyskiwanie danych OSM ze strony Geofabrik
link//pl/osm-data/geofabrik-and-hot-export/#pobieranie-danych osm-na-stronie-narzędzia-hot-export@@@@Pobieranie danych OSM na stronie narzędzia HOT Export
link//pl/coordination/remote-tracing/@@@@Odwzorowywanie dróg, budynków, wody i zagospodarowania terenu

link//pl/coordination/remote-tracing/#--navigation-software-such-as-garmin-devices-and-apps.-on-smartphones-such-as-osmand-can-provide-routing-information-over-great-distances-if-the-correct-information-is-loaded-into-them.-as-these-rely-on-the-gps-within-the-device-to-locate-the-position-in-relation-to-the-basemap-loaded-into-them,-it-is-important-that-the-highways-are-actually-within-about-15-metres-of-the-right-place,-or-they-will-not-work!@@@@-  Navigation software such as Garmin devices and apps. on smartphones such as Osmand can provide routing information over great distances if the correct information is loaded into them. As these rely on the gps within the device to locate the position in relation to the basemap loaded into them, it is important that the highways are actually within about 15 metres of the right place, or they will not work!

link//pl/coordination/remote-tracing/#--[west-african-hot-mapping-tips-by-user-bgirardot](http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/user:bgirardot/typical_road_and_residential_task)@@@@-  [West African HOT Mapping Tips by user Bgirardot](http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/User:Bgirardot/Typical_Road_and_Residential_Task)

link//pl/josm/correcting-imagery-offset/#--if-you-like,-you-can-save-these-offset-settings-by-entering-a-bookmark-name-and-then-clicking-ok.-you-can-then-automatically-apply-the-same-settings-later-by-going-to-imagery-‣-imagery-offset-and-clicking-on-your-bookmark.@@@@- If you like, you can save these offset settings by entering a bookmark name and then clicking OK. You can then automatically apply the same settings later by going to Imagery ‣ Imagery offset and clicking on your bookmark.

link//pl/josm/correcting-imagery-offset/#--click-on-the-button-and-the-plugin-will-communicate-with-the-database-to-see-if-there-are-existing-offsets-in-this-area.@@@@- Click on the button and the plugin will communicate with the database to see if there are existing offsets in this area.

link//pl/beginner/#czy-jesteś-nowym-użytkownikiem-openstreetmap-i-chcesz-ulepszyć-mapę-poprzez-dodawanie-danych?@@@@Czy jesteś nowym użytkownikiem OpenStreetMap i chcesz ulepszyć mapę poprzez dodawanie danych?

link//pl/beginner/#najważniejsze-jest,-aby-nauczyć-się,-w-jaki-sposób-tworzenie-mapy-w-tym-kontekście-jest-koordynowane.@@@@Najważniejsze jest, aby nauczyć się, w jaki sposób tworzenie mapy w tym kontekście jest koordynowane.
link//pl/beginner/#czy-chciałbyś-używać-openstreetmap-na-urządzeniach-mobilnych?@@@@Czy chciałbyś używać OpenStreetMap na urządzeniach mobilnych?
link//pl/beginner/#znasz-narzędzia-gis-i-chcesz-mieć-dostęp-do-nieprzetworzonych-danych?@@@@Znasz narzędzia GIS i chcesz mieć dostęp do nieprzetworzonych danych?
link//pl/osm-data/osmosis/#--kliknij-ok-kilka-razy,-aby-zapisać-nowe-ustawienia.@@@@- Kliknij OK kilka razy, aby zapisać nowe ustawienia.
link//pl/hot-tips/@@@@Porady HOT - Rozpoczynanie pracy dla nowych maperów - edytor iD

link//pl/josm/editing-with-josm/#--you-should-see-the-layer-that-you-selected-disappear-in-the-map-window.-click-show/hide-again,-and-it-will-reappear.@@@@-   You should see the layer that you selected disappear in the map window. Click Show/Hide again, and it will reappear.

link//pl/josm/editing-with-josm/#--lastly,-it’s-important-to-know-that-you-can-only-edit-the-layer-that-is-considered-*active*-by-josm.-if-you-are-unable-to-edit-the-map-in-your-map-window,-it’s-probably-because-you-don’t-have-the-correct-layer-set-as-active.-most-layers,-such-as-gps-points,-field-papers,-and-satellite-imagery,-can’t-be-edited.-the-only-layers-that-can-be-edited-are-data-from-openstreetmap,-which-are-usually-called-“data-layer-1”.@@@@-   Lastly, it’s important to know that you can only edit the layer that is considered *active* by JOSM. If you are unable to edit the map in your map window, it’s probably because you don’t have the correct layer set as active. Most layers, such as GPS points, Field Papers, and satellite imagery, can’t be edited. The only layers that can be edited are data from OpenStreetMap, which are usually called “Data Layer 1”.
link//pl/josm/editing-with-josm/#--to-edit-an-object's-tags,-first-select-it.@@@@-   To edit an object's tags, first select it.
link//pl/josm/editing-with-josm/#common-mistake:-tagging-nodes-when-you-want-to-tag-lines-or-polygons@@@@Common Mistake: Tagging nodes when you want to tag lines or polygons
